abstract: Global warming-related inundation of coastal areas in United States, possibility scientists have warned of for years, has become reality, with high tides and flooding threatening many communities; coasts have experienced sharp jump in nuisance flooding that swamps roads, damages property and poisons wells, even as scientists say effects could worsen quickly; experts say lack of action by Congress has left nation without broad policy on sea-level rise and has allowed federal government to continue spending in ways that magnify risks.
lead_paragraph: Scientists’ warnings that the rise of the sea would eventually imperil the United States’ coastline are no longer theoretical.
snippet: Scientists’ warnings that the rise of the sea would eventually imperil the United States’ coastline are no longer theoretical....

headline.main: Flooding of Coast, Caused by Global Warming, Has Already Begun
headline.sub: Global Warming Marker: Inundation of the Coast Has Begun Submerging of Coast Has Already Begun, Thanks to Global Warming...
